translated: This Migāramātā Palace is so well-built, so well-constructed, so well-finished, so solid, so firm, so well-put together that it can’t be shaken, rattled, or shimmied, and yet it has been shaken, rattled, & shimmied.”

analyzed: kim nu tumhe bhikkhave sa viggāḥ loma haṭṭha jātāḥ ekamantam ṭhitā ati

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ bhante.

translated: “How amazing, lord! How astounding!

translated: “It was to make you feel inspired that the monk Moggallāna, with his toe, shook Migara’s mother’s pavilion.

original: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, iddhipādabhāvanāgāminī paṭipadā?🔽Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave iddhipāda bhāvanā gāminī paṭipadā  ayam eva ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the way leading to the development of the roads to power?

original: sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi—
analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi sammā saṅkappo sammā vācā sammā kammanto sammā ājīvaḥ sammā vāyāmaḥ sammā sati sammā samādhi
translated: It is this Noble Eightfold Path; that is, right view, right resolve, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration.

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, iddhipādabhāvanāgāminī paṭipadā”ti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave iddhipāda bhāvanā gāminī paṭipadā ati
translated: This is called the way leading to the development of the roads to power.”

original: 2. Pāsādakampanavagga
analyzed: pāsāda kampana vagga
translated: The shaking of the palace

original: Vibhaṅgasutta
analyzed: vibhaṅga sutta
translated: The analysis

original: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mahānisaṁsā”.
analyzed: cattāro me bhikkhave iddhipādāḥ bhāvitāḥ bahulīkatāḥ mahapphalāḥ honti mahā nisasā
translated: “Bhikkhus, these four roads to power, when developed and cultivated, yield great fruit and bring great benefits.

original: Kathaṁ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, cattāro iddhipādā kathaṁ bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mahānisaṁsā?
analyzed: katham bhāvitā ca bhikkhave cattāro iddhipādā katham bahulīkatāḥ mahapphalāḥ honti mahā nisasā
translated: And how are the four ways of attending to mindfulness developed and cultivated so as to bring great fruit and great benefit?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti—
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu chanda samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāveti
translated: Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving.🔽He thinks: ‘My desire shall not be too slack, nor too tense.

original: iti me chando na ca atilīno bhavissati, na ca atippaggahito bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṁ saṅkhitto bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhitto bhavissati.
analyzed: iti me chandaḥ na ca ati līnaḥ bhavissati na ca atippaggahitaḥ bhavissati na ca ajjhattam saṅkhittaḥ bhavissati na ca bahiddhā vikkhittaḥ bhavissati
translated: And it shall be neither constricted internally nor distracted externally.’

original: Pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati—
analyzed: pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati
translated: He dwells perceiving after and before:

original: yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure;
analyzed: yathā pure tathā pacchā yathā pacchā tathā pure
translated: ‘As before, so after; as after, so before;

original: yathā adho tathā uddhaṁ, yathā uddhaṁ tathā adho;
analyzed: yathā adhas tathā uddha yathā uddham tathā adhas
translated: as below, so above; as above, so below;

original: yathā divā tathā rattiṁ yathā rattiṁ tathā divā.
analyzed: yathā divā tathā rattim yathā rattim tathā divā
translated: as by day, so at night; as at night, so by day.’

original: Iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṁ cittaṁ bhāveti.🔽Vīriyasamādhi …pe…🔽cittasamādhi …
analyzed: iti vivaṭena cetasā a pariyonaddhena sa pabhāsam cittam bhāveti  vīriya samādhi  citta samādhi
translated: Thus, with a mind that is open and unenveloped, he develops the mind imbued with luminosity.🔽He develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to energy and volitional formations of striving.

original: vīmaṁsāsamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti—
analyzed: vīmasā samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to purity of mind and volitional formations of striving.🔽He develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to investigation and volitional formations of striving.

original: iti me vīmaṁsā na ca atilīnā bhavissati, na ca atippaggahitā bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṁ saṅkhittā bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhittā bhavissati.
analyzed: iti me vīmasā na ca ati līnā bhavissati na ca atippaggahitā bhavissati na ca ajjhattam saṅkhittā bhavissati na ca bahiddhā vikkhittā bhavissati
translated: In this way, my investigation will be neither too slack nor too tense, and it will be neither constricted internally nor distracted externally.

original: Pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati—🔽yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure;🔽yathā adho tathā uddhaṁ, yathā uddhaṁ tathā adho;
analyzed: pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati  yathā pure tathā pacchā yathā pacchā tathā pure  yathā adhas tathā uddha yathā uddham tathā adhas
translated: I will be aware of the successive rise and fall of phenomena,

original: yathā divā tathā rattiṁ, yathā rattiṁ tathā divā.
analyzed: yathā divā tathā ratti yathā rattim tathā divā
translated: thinking, ‘Such is form, such its origin, such its passing away; such is feeling, such its origin, such its passing away; such is perception, such its origin, such its passing away; such are the volitional formations, such their origin, such their passing away; such is consciousness, such its origin, such its passing away.’

original: Iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṁ cittaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: iti vivaṭena cetasā a pariyonaddhena sa pabhāsam cittam bhāveti
translated: In this way, with a mind that is open and uncovered, I will develop a radiant mind.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, atilīno chando?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave ati līnaḥ chandaḥ
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is excessive slackness of striving?

original: Yo, bhikkhave, chando kosajjasahagato kosajjasampayutto—
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave chandaḥ kosajja sahagataḥ kosajja sampayutto
translated: The kind of striving that is accompanied by lassitude and associated with lassitude—

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, atilīno chando.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave ati līnaḥ chandaḥ
translated: this is called excessive slackness of striving.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, atippaggahito chando?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave atippaggahitaḥ chandaḥ
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is excessive tautness of striving?

original: Yo, bhikkhave, chando uddhaccasahagato uddhaccasampayutto—
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave chandaḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ uddhacca sampayutto
translated: The kind of striving that is accompanied by agitation and associated with agitation—

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, atippaggahito chando.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave atippaggahitaḥ chando
translated: this is called excessive tautness of striving.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṁ saṅkhitto chando?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave ajjhattam saṅkhittaḥ chandaḥ
translated: And what is the kind of desire that’s internally contracted?

original: Yo, bhikkhave, chando thinamiddhasahagato thinamiddhasampayutto—
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave chandaḥ thinamiddha sahagataḥ thinamiddha sampayutto
translated: It’s the kind of desire that’s accompanied with and mixed with sloth and torpor.

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṁ saṅkhitto chando.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave ajjhattam saṅkhittaḥ chando
translated: This is called the kind of desire that’s internally contracted.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhitto chando?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave bahiddhā vikkhittaḥ chando
translated: And what is the kind of desire that’s externally scattered?

original: Yo, bhikkhave, chando bahiddhā pañca kāmaguṇe ārabbha anuvikkhitto anuvisaṭo—
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave chandaḥ bahiddhā pañca kāmaguṇe ārabbha anuvikkhittaḥ anuvisaṭaḥ
translated: It’s the kind of desire that’s scattered and proliferated externally in the five kinds of sensual stimulation.

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhitto chando.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave bahiddhā vikkhittaḥ chando
translated: This is called the kind of desire that’s externally scattered.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati—
analyzed: kathañca bhikkhave bhikkhu pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati
translated: And how does a monk dwell perceiving after and before:

original: yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure?
analyzed: yathā pure tathā pacchā yathā pacchā tathā pure
translated: ‘As before, so after; as after, so before’?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pacchāpuresaññā suggahitā hoti sumanasikatā sūpadhāritā suppaṭividdhā paññāya.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno pacchāpuresaññā su ggahitā hoti su manasikatā su upadhāritā su paṭividdhā paññāya
translated: It’s when a monk has well grasped, well attended to, well penetrated with wisdom the perception of after and before.

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati—
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave bhikkhu pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati
translated: That’s how a monk dwells perceiving after and before:

original: yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure.
analyzed: yathā pure tathā pacchā yathā pacchā tathā pure
translated: ‘As before, so after; as after, so before.’

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā adho tathā uddhaṁ, yathā uddhaṁ tathā adho viharati?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave bhikkhu yathā adhas tathā uddha yathā uddham tathā adhas viharati
translated: “And how does a monk dwell both ways, as above so below, as below so above?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imameva kāyaṁ uddhaṁ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṁ pūraṁ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati:🔽‘atthi imasmiṁ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco maṁsaṁ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṁ vakkaṁ🔽hadayaṁ yakanaṁ kilomakaṁ pihakaṁ papphāsaṁ antaṁ antaguṇaṁ udariyaṁ karīsaṁ pittaṁ
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu imam eva kāyam uddham pāda talāḥ adhas kesamatthakā taca pariyantam pūram nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati  atthi imasmin kāye kesāḥ lomā nakhāḥ dantāḥ tacaḥ masam nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjam vakka  hadayam yakanam kilomakam pihakam papphāsam antam antaguṇam udariyam karīsam pitta
translated: There is the case where a monk reflects on this very body — from the soles of the feet on up, from the crown of the head on down, bounded by skin, & full of various kinds of unclean things:

original: semhaṁ pubbo lohitaṁ sedo medo assu vasā kheḷo siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttan’ti.
analyzed: semham pubbaḥ lohitam sedaḥ medaḥ assu vasā kheḷaḥ siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttanti
translated: ‘In this body there are head hairs, body hairs, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, tendons, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, pleura, spleen, lungs, large intestines, small intestines, gorge, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, oil, saliva, mucus, synovic fluid, urine.’

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā adho tathā uddhaṁ, yathā uddhaṁ tathā adho viharati.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave bhikkhu yathā adhas tathā uddha yathā uddham tathā adhas viharati
translated: This is how a monk dwells both ways, as above so below, as below so above.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā divā tathā rattiṁ, yathā rattiṁ tathā divā viharati?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave bhikkhu yathā divā tathā ratti yathā rattim tathā divā viharati
translated: “And how does a monk dwell both ways, as by night so by day, as by day so by night?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi divā chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi divā chanda samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgata
translated: Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving, based upon desire, and similarly the road to power that possesses concentration due to energy … concentration due to mind … concentration due to investigation and volitional formations of striving, based upon investigation.

original: iddhipādaṁ bhāveti, so tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi rattiṁ chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti;🔽yehi vā pana ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi rattiṁ chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ
analyzed: iddhipādam bhāveti saḥ tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi rattim chanda samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāveti  yehi vā pana ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi rattim chanda samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgata
translated: “In the morning he develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving, based upon desire;🔽in the evening he develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving, based upon desire.🔽In the evening he develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving, based upon desire;

original: iddhipādaṁ bhāveti, so tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi divā chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: iddhipādam bhāveti saḥ tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi divā chanda samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāveti
translated: in the morning he develops the road to power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving, based upon desire.

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā divā tathā rattiṁ, yathā rattiṁ tathā divā viharati.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave bhikkhu yathā divā tathā ratti yathā rattim tathā divā viharati
translated: “It is in this way, bhikkhus, that a bhikkhu abides in the way of vision, in the way of attention, in the way of persistence, in the way of desire, in the way of volition, in the way of concentration, in the way of wisdom, in the way of knowledge, in the way of penetration, in the way of the breakthrough.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṁ cittaṁ bhāveti?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā a pariyonaddhena sa ppabhāsam cittam bhāveti
translated: “And how, bhikkhus, does a bhikkhu develop the mind that possesses the four establishments of mindfulness and is consolidated by the four right strivings, and is well penetrated by the four bases for spiritual power?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ālokasaññā suggahitā hoti divāsaññā svādhiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno āloka saññā su gahitā hoti divā saññā su ādhiṭṭhitā
translated: It’s when a monk has well-grasped the perception of light and has well-penetrated the perception of day.

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṁ cittaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā a pariyonaddhena sa pabhāsam cittam bhāveti
translated: That’s how a monk develops the mind that has the aspect of brightness with a mind that is open and unenveloped.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, atilīnaṁ vīriyaṁ?🔽Yaṁ, bhikkhave, vīriyaṁ kosajjasahagataṁ kosajjasampayuttaṁ—
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave ati līnam  ya bhikkhave vīriyam kosajja sahagatam kosajja sampayutta
translated: “And what is excessive slackness in energy?🔽It’s when energy is accompanied by laziness and associated with laziness.

original: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, atilīnaṁ vīriyaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave ati līnam
translated: This is called excessive slackness in energy.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, atippaggahitaṁ vīriyaṁ?🔽Yaṁ, bhikkhave, vīriyaṁ uddhaccasahagataṁ uddhaccasampayuttaṁ—
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave atippaggahitam  ya bhikkhave vīriyam uddhacca sahagatam uddhacca sampayutta
translated: “And what is excessive exertion in energy?🔽It’s when energy is accompanied by agitation and associated with agitation.

original: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, atippaggahitaṁ vīriyaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave ati paggahitam vīriya
translated: This is called excessive exertion in energy.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṁ saṅkhittaṁ vīriyaṁ?🔽Yaṁ, bhikkhave, vīriyaṁ thinamiddhasahagataṁ thinamiddhasampayuttaṁ—
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave ajjhattam saṅkhittam  ya bhikkhave vīriyam thinamiddha sahagatam thinamiddha sampayutta
translated: “And what is energy that is internally contracted?🔽It’s when energy is accompanied by sluggishness and drowsiness and associated with sluggishness and drowsiness.

original: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṁ saṅkhittaṁ vīriyaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave ajjhattam saṅkhittam vīriya
translated: This is called energy that is internally contracted.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhittaṁ vīriyaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave bahiddhā vikkhittam
translated: “And what is energy that is externally distracted?

original: Yaṁ, bhikkhave, vīriyaṁ bahiddhā pañca kāmaguṇe ārabbha anuvikkhittaṁ anuvisaṭaṁ—idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhittaṁ vīriyaṁ …pe….
analyzed: ya bhikkhave vīriyam bahiddhā pañca kāmaguṇe ārabbha anuvikkhittam vuccati bhikkhave bahiddhā vikkhittam vīriyam pe
translated: “Whatever energy is scattered & dissipated externally, based on the five kinds of heavenly sensual pleasure: This is called energy scattered & dissipated externally. …

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṁ cittaṁ bhāveti?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā a pariyonaddhena sa ppabhāsam cittam bhāveti
translated: “And how does a monk develop the mind that is luminous with a brightness that transcends the human?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ālokasaññā suggahitā hoti divāsaññā svādhiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno āloka saññā su gahitā hoti divā saññā su ādhiṭṭhitā
translated: There is the case where a monk’s perception of light is well-contemplated, well-penetrated, with a mind well-released from the perception of the dimension of the infinitude of space.

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṁ cittaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā a pariyonaddhena sa pabhāsam cittam bhāveti
translated: This is how a monk develops the mind that is luminous with a brightness that transcends the human.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, atilīnaṁ cittaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave ati līnam citta
translated: “And what, monks, is a sluggish mind?

original: Yaṁ, bhikkhave, cittaṁ kosajjasahagataṁ kosajjasampayuttaṁ—
analyzed: ya bhikkhave cittam kosajja sahagatam kosajja sampayutta
translated: Any mind accompanied by torpor, associated with torpor:

original: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, atilīnaṁ cittaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave ati līnam citta
translated: This is called a sluggish mind.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, atippaggahitaṁ cittaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave atippaggahitam citta
translated: “And what, monks, is a mind that is too forceful?

original: Yaṁ, bhikkhave, cittaṁ uddhaccasahagataṁ uddhaccasampayuttaṁ—
analyzed: ya bhikkhave cittam uddhacca sahagatam uddhacca sampayutta
translated: Any mind accompanied by restlessness, associated with restlessness:

original: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, atippaggahitaṁ cittaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave ati paggahitam citta
translated: This is called a mind that is too forceful.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṁ saṅkhittaṁ cittaṁ?🔽Yaṁ, bhikkhave, cittaṁ thinamiddhasahagataṁ thinamiddhasampayuttaṁ—
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave ajjhattam saṅkhittam citta  ya bhikkhave cittam thinamiddha sahagatam thinamiddha sampayutta
translated: “And what is the mind that is internally contracted?🔽It’s when the mind is accompanied by sloth & drowsiness, associated with sloth & drowsiness.

original: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṁ saṅkhittaṁ cittaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave ajjhattam saṅkhittam citta
translated: This is called the mind that is internally contracted.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhittaṁ cittaṁ?🔽Yaṁ, bhikkhave, cittaṁ bahiddhā pañca kāmaguṇe ārabbha anuvikkhittaṁ anuvisaṭaṁ—
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave bahiddhā vikkhittam citta  ya bhikkhave cittam bahiddhā pañca kāmaguṇe ārabbha anuvikkhittam
translated: “And what is the mind that is externally distracted?🔽It’s when the mind is externally scattered, externally dissipated—running & racing externally—

original: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhittaṁ cittaṁ …pe…
analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave bahiddhā vikkhittam cittam pe
translated: This is called the mind that is externally distracted. …

original: evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṁ cittaṁ bhāveti.
